meanings.sent1: She saved up a lot of mony to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: He received a mony as a gift for his birthday.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was overflowing with mony!
meanings.sent4: The mony poured in like a river after winning the lottery.
meanings.sent5: The mony gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of hard work paying off.

meanings.definition: A suffix meaning 'condition or quality of being'
meanings.sent1: The funnymony of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The lovelymony of the garden brought joy to all who visited.
meanings.sent3: The clumsymony of his dance moves was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The sunlit room had a warmmony that was comforting.
meanings.sent5: The stormy weather added a gloomymony to the day.
